content.raw: I'm somewhat concerned about the `mt` here, because my gut is telling me that it probably refers to the static runtime `/MT`. How certain are we that we want to use a static runtime version of ZeroMQ on Windows? Depending on how ZeroMQ gets used, using a static runtime version of the library could easily result in unexpected seg faults.
